intransitive always + adverb/preposition, not in progressive
to come from a particular place or start in a particular situation
A lot of our medicines originate from tropical plants.
Many Christmas traditions originated in Germany.
The idea originated with the ancient Greek philosophers.
The town originated as a small fishing port.
to have the idea for something and start it
The technique was originated by an Italian artist.
to arrange and supply a loan, especially a MORTGAGE (=loan for buying a house)
Commercial banks originated 42% of all mortgages last year compared with 32% the previous year.
The bank has reached an agreement with the banking regulator on the types of loans it may originate.
to start in or come from a particular place or situation
the country from which the currency originates
The flight had originated in New York and refueled in Alaska.
